1.name: Population density
1.measure: 1-(Average number of people per area ÷ SV)

2.name: Population distribution
2.measure: % population living in urban area

1.name: Age
1.measure: % population whose age is between 18 and  65

2.name: Place attachment-not recent immigrants
2.measure: 1-(% population not foreign-born persons who came within previous five years)

3.name: Population stability
3.measure: 1-% population change over previous five year period

1.name: Educational attainment equality
1.measure: % population with college education – % population with less than high school education

2.name: Homeownership
2.measure: % owned-occupied housing units

4.name: Gender income equality
4.measure: Absolute value of ( % male median income – % female median income)

6.name: Poverty
6.measure: 1-% population whose income is below minimum wage

1.name: Water quality/quantity
1.measure: Number of river miles whose water is usable ÷ SV

1.name: Air pollution
1.measure: 1-(Air quality index (AQI) ÷ SV)

1.name: Natural flood buffers
1.measure: % land in wetlands ÷ SV

2.name: Pervious surfaces
2.measure: Average percent perviousness

3.name: Soil quality
3.measure: % land area that does not contain erodible soils

1.name: Living species
1.measure: 1-% species susceptible to extinction

1.name: Total mass of organisms
1.measure: Harvest index (HI) the ratio between root weight and total biomass

2.name: Density of green vegetation across an area
2.measure: Normalized difference vegetation index (NDVI)

1.name: Undeveloped forest
1.measure: % land area that is undeveloped forest ÷ SV

2.name: Wetland variation
2.measure: % land area with no wetland decline

3.name: Land use stability
3.measure: % land area with no land-use change ÷ SV

4.name: Protected land
4.measure: % land area under protected status ÷ SV

5.name: Arable cultivated land
5.measure: % land area that is arable cultivated land ÷ SV

1.name: Health insurance
1.measure: % population under age 65 with health insurance

2.name: Disaster aid experience
2.measure: Presidential disaster declarations divided by number of loss-causing hazard events ÷ SV

3.name: Local disaster training
3.measure: % population in communities with Citizen Corps program

4.name: Emergency response services
4.measure: % workforce employed in emergency services (fire-fighting - law enforcement - protection) ÷ SV

5.name: Schools
5.measure: Number of schools per 1000 students ÷ SV

1.name: Jurisdictional coordination
1.measure: Governments and special districts per 10000 persons ÷ SV

1.name: Performance regimes-state capital
1.measure: Proximity of county seat to state capital ÷ SV

2.name: Performance regimes-nearest metro area
2.measure: Proximity of county seat to nearest county seat within a Metropolitan Statistical Area ÷ SV

1.name: Mitigation spending
1.measure: Ten year average per capita spending for mitigation projects ÷ SV

2.name: Nuclear plant accident planning
2.measure: 1-% population within 10 miles of nuclear power plant

3.name: Effective mitigation plans
3.measure: % population covered by a recent hazard mitigation plan

4.name: Exposure to hazards
4.measure: % building infrastructure not in high hazard zones

5.name: Protective resources
5.measure: % land area that consists of windbreaks and environmental plantings

6.name: Financed activities for risk reduction
6.measure: % governmental financial resources to carry out risk reduction activities ÷ SV

7.name: Essential infrastructure robustness
7.measure: % of local schools - hospitals and health facilities that remained operational during emergencies in past events

8.name: Essential infrastructure assessment
8.measure: % essential infrastructures that are under regular assessment programs

9.name: Accuracy of building codes
9.measure: % designed structural damage – % actual structural damage (from past events)

10.name: Training programs for officials
10.measure: % of officials and leaders who are under regular training programs

11.name: Availability of early warning centers
11.measure: Average number of early warning centers per each independent zone  ÷ SV

12.name: Citizen disaster preparedness and response skills
12.measure: Red cross training workshop participants per 10000 persons ÷ SV

1.name: Money dedicated to supporting the restoration
1.measure: Microfinancing - cash aid - soft loans - loan guarantees available to affected households after disasters to restart livelihoods ÷ SV

2.name: Ecosystem support plans
2.measure: Local government plan to support the restoration - protection and sustainable management of ecosystems services (0 or 1)

3.name: Local institutions access to financial reserves to support effective disaster response and early recovery

4.name: Local government access to resources and expertise to assist victims of psycho-social impacts of disasters

5.name: Disaster risk reduction measures integrated into post-disaster recovery and rehabilitation activities

6.name: Contingency plan degree including an outline strategy for post-disaster recovery and reconstruction

1.name: Sturdier housing types
1.measure: % housing units not manufactured homes

2.name: Temporary housing availability
2.measure: % vacant units that are for rent

4.name: Community services
4.measure: %Area of community services (recreational facilities - parks - historic sites - libraries - museums) total area ÷ SV

5.name: Economic infrastructure exposure
5.measure: % commercial establishments outside of high hazard zones ÷ total commercial establishment

7.name: Hotels and accommodations
7.measure: Number of hotels per total area ÷ SV

8.name: Schools
8.measure: Schools area (primary and secondary education) per population ÷ SV

1.name: Telecommunication
1.measure: Average number of Internet - television - radio - telephone and telecommunications broadcasters per household ÷ SV

2.name: Mental health support
2.measure: number of beds per 100 000 population ÷ SV

3.name: Physician access
3.measure: Number of physicians per population ÷ SV

4.name: Medical care capacity
4.measure: Number of available hospital beds per 100000 population ÷ SV

5.name: Evacuation routes
5.measure: Major road egress points per building ÷ SV

6.name: Industrial re-supply potential
6.measure: Rail miles per total area ÷ SV

7.name: High-speed internet infrastructure
7.measure: % population with access to broadband internet service

8.name: Efficient energy use
8.measure: Ratio of Megawatt power production to demand

9.name: Efficient Water Use
9.measure: Ratio of water available to water demand

10.name: Gas
10.measure: Ratio of gas production to gas demand

11.name: Access and evacuation
11.measure: Principal arterial miles per total area ÷ SV

12.name: Transportation
12.measure: Number of rail miles per area ÷ SV

13.name: Waste water treatment
13.measure: Number of WWT units per population ÷ SV

1.name: Authorities interdependency
1.measure: Less than 3 parties are involved in the decision-making process (1) - otherwise (0)

1.name: Creative class
1.measure: % workforce employed in professional occupations ÷ SV

2.name: Scientific services
2.measure: Professional - scientific - and technical hour services per population ÷ SV

1.name: Means of transport
1.measure: % households with at least one vehicle

2.name: Safety
2.measure: Crime rate

3.name: Quality of homes
3.measure: Sustainability rating systems (LEED - BREEAM) ÷ maximum index number

4.name: Quality of neighborhood
4.measure: Sustainability rating systems (LEED - BREEAM) ÷ maximum index number

1.name: Hazard insurance coverage
1.measure: % housing units covered by National Insurance Program

2.name: Crop insurance coverage
2.measure: Lands areas which are covered by Crop insurance program ÷ total area of cultivated lands

3.name: Financial resource equity
3.measure: Number of lending institutions per population ÷ SV

4.name: Tax revenues
4.measure: Corporate tax revenues per 1000 population ÷ SV

1.name: Employment rate
1.measure: % labor force employed ÷ SV

2.name: Business size
2.measure: % large businesses

3.name: Professional and business services
3.measure: 1-% population that is not institutionalized or infirmed

5.name: Economic diversity
5.measure: % population not employed in primary industries ÷ total employed population

6.name: Households insurance
6.measure: % households covered by National Insurance Program policies

7.name: Research and development firms
7.measure: Number of research and development firms ÷ SV

1.name: Food provisioning capacity
1.measure: Food security rate

2.name: Large retail-regional/national geographic distribution
2.measure: Large retail stores ÷ total number of stores

3.name: Local food suppliers
3.measure: Farms marketing products through Community supported Agriculture per 10000 persons ÷ SV

4.name: Manufacturing
4.measure: Mean sales volume of businesses ÷ SV

1.name: Child and elderly care programs
1.measure: 1 (if there is a program) - 0 (if no)

1.name: Social capital-civic organizations
1.measure: Number of civic organizations per population ÷ SV

2.name: Commercial establishments
2.measure: Area of commercial establishments per population ÷ SV

1.name: Pre-retirement age
1.measure: % population below 65 years of age

2.name: Non-special needs
2.measure: % population without sensory - physical or mental disability

3.name: Political engagement
3.measure: % voting age population participating in presidential election

5.name: Population participating in community Rating System
5.measure: % population participating in Community Rating System (CRS)

6.name: Emergency community participation
6.measure: % community participation in case of warning systems

1.name: Cultural resources
1.measure: National Historic Registry sites area per population ÷ SV

1.name: English language competency
1.measure: % population proficient English Speakers

2.name: Adult education and training programs
2.measure: Number of yearly adult education and training programs per population ÷ SV

3.name: Education programs on DRR and disaster preparedness for local communities
3.measure: Number of education programs on DRR and disaster preparedness per each local community by local government per year ÷ SV

4.name: Integration of disaster risk reduction in educational curriculum
4.measure: Number of courses in disaster risk reduction as part of the educational curriculum per schools and colleges ÷ SV

5.name: Citizens awareness of evacuation plans or drills for evacuations
5.measure: Average  number of maneuver per institution ÷ SV

1.name: Social capital-disaster volunteerism
1.measure: Red cross volunteers per 10000 persons ÷ SV

1.name: Social capital-religious organizations
1.measure: Persons affiliated with a religious organization per 10000 persons ÷ SV
